getCurrentPot().return: The amount of token in the current pot

getCurrentStakeAmount(uint256).details: Return the amount of token in the provided caller's stake

params._stakeID: The ID of the stake of the caller

getLowestStake(address).details: Returns the lowest stake info of the current account

params.customer: Customer where the lowest stake is returned

getLowestStake(address).return: uint The stake amountuint The stake ID

getPotentialWithdrawAmount().details: Check if the pot has enough balance to satisfy the potential withdraw

getStakeCount().details: Get the number of active stake of the caller

getStakeInfo(uint256).details: Return all the available stake info

params._stakeID: ID of the stake which info is returned

getStakeInfo(uint256).return: 1) Amount Deposited2) Bool value that tells if the stake was withdrawed3) Stake creation time (Unix timestamp)4) The eventual referAccountess != address(0), "No contract set");5) The current amount6) The penalty of withdraw

getTotalStakeAmount().details: Return sum of all the caller's stake amount

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returnTokens(uint256).details: Return the staked tokens, requiring that the stake was       not alreay withdrawed

params._stakeID: The ID of the stake to be returned

stakeToken(uint256,address).details: Stake token verifying all the contraint

params._referralAddress: Address of the referer; 0x000...1 if no referer is provided

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawFromPot(uint256).details: Check if the provided amount is available in the pot  If yes, it will update the pot value and return true  Otherwise it will emit a PotExhausted event and return false
